title: What are the pros and cons of liberalism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Classical Liberalism should not be confused with Liberal Politics as it almost invariably is in the USA - To advocate Liberalism is to be a Libertine which is essentially being the same as an Anarchist in thought & behaviour - The label of Liberal in Political terms is largely a misnomer- In ‘America’ most so called Liberals are better described as Progressives, Reformers or Improvers - Whilst they seek greater liberty from numerous constraints & restrictions imposed by a Capitalistic Economic system, Religious or Political Ideology, Progressives don’t advocate the complete removal of all Societies rules & necessary regulations, as true Libertarians do TBC ( To be continued) - Those labelled as Liberals who are usually voters for, or members of the Democratic Party in the U.S. are unacceptable to conservative minded people across the Socio - Economic spectrum seemingly because they are considered soft & not tough enough on all all manner of issues, as in being called ‘ bleeding heart liberals’ a truly ridiculous description for those who are more caring & considerate, about what happens with people in Society & other animals, as well as the total Environment- Along with this they are considered insufficiently firm on most issues generally not being followers of any Ideology - This ‘open minded’ attitude appears to be unsettling to most of the conservatively inclined - So called ‘liberals ‘ are far less likely to be conformist & thus they’re often difficult to ‘pigeon hole’ - This results in ‘liberals’ being viewed as somewhat unpredictable & not sufficiently patriotic as few adhere rigidly to any belief system - Being generally anti guns & only sanctioning Military action as a last result American ‘Liberal’ Progressives are disparagingly referred to as being weak called ‘wimps’& ‘peacenicks’ - As most American ‘Democrats’ are supporters of Civil Rights they were labelled as ‘nigger lovers’ & probably still are by many conservative racists - Now those who support ‘Equal Rights’ are pejoratively called Socialists The majority of those conservative by nature are unnerved in seeing ‘Liberals’ & “liberalism’ as wanting to change too many things & ‘conservatives ‘ in general aren’t comfortable with any change, unless it can be seen as without being in any way being detrimental to them & entirely without doubt as to their benefit - ‘Liberals’ in contrast are constantly in pursuit of positive change & improvement- Apart from being far more adaptive to change the most positive aspect of true sensible ‘liberalism’ is the pursuit of human freedom but freedom with responsibility

Being liberal promotes comradery with other people. Liberals believe that politics and economics are based on the wellbeing of the community, which encourages redistribution and public spending. This mode of thought allowed the middle class to be a significant component of the United States’ social system. FDR is the prototype for modern American liberalism, and Bernie Sanders is a political reincarnation. On the other hand, liberalism can deter some people from taking chances, which is disadvantageous in the business world. All business endeavors carry some form of risk involved. Being an entrepreneur often requires citizens to break free from the safety net provided by American liberalism. Liberalism can disincentivize innovation.
